0.description:
{Spell Book}

Left-click on the spell book to view your spells.
0.event: You trip over the Spell Book, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
0.name: Spell Book

1.description:
{Spell Scroll}

This scroll contains the [spell name] spell which is added into your spell book for as long as you carry the scroll.
1.event: You find an elaborate container which houses an old vellum scroll. The runes on the container are very old, and the artistry with which it was put together is stunning. As you pull the scroll out, you feel imbued with magical power.
1.name: Spell Scroll

10.description:
{Ogre's Club of Havoc}

This right handed weapon increases your Attack skill by +5.
10.event: At a roadside tavern, a drunken Ogre challenges you to a fight.  Not wanting to hurt the creature, you subdue him instead, and take his massive club from him to prevent him from getting into any more trouble.
10.name: Ogre's Club of Havoc

100.description:
{Pendant of Dispassion}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Berserk spell.
100.event: The sound of combat draws you to the scene of a fight between an old Barbarian and an eight-headed Hydra.  Your timely intervention swings the battle in favor of the man, and he rewards you with a pendant he used to use to calm his mind for battle.
100.name: Pendant of Dispassion

101.description:
{Pendant of Second Sight}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Blind spell.
101.event: You come upon a very old woman, long blind from cataracts and dying alone.  You tend to her final needs and promise a proper burial.  Grateful, she gives you a magic pendant emblazoned with a stylized eye.  It lets you see with your eyes closed.
101.name: Pendant of Second Sight

102.description:
{Pendant of Holiness}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Curse spell.
102.event: In your wanderings you come across a hermit living in a small, tidy hut.  Impressed with your mission, he takes time out from his meditations to bless and give you a charm against curses.
102.name: Pendant of Holiness

103.description:
{Pendant of Life}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Death Ripple spell.
103.event: A fierce windstorm reveals the entrance to a buried tomb.  Your investigation reveals that the tomb has already been looted, but the thieves overlooked an ankh on a gold chain in the dark.
103.name: Pendant of Life

104.description:
{Pendant of Death}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Destroy Undead spell.
104.event: A quick and deadly battle with a Necromancer wins you his magical pendant.  Later, a Wizard tells you that the pendant protects undead under your control from spells meant to destroy them.
104.name: Pendant of Death

105.description:
{Pendant of Free Will}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Hypnotize spell.
105.event: A brief roadside encounter with a small caravan and a game of knucklebones wins a magic pendant.  Its former owner says that it protects against hypnosis.
105.name: Pendant of Free Will

106.description:
{Pendant of Negativity}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning spells.
106.event: You come upon the remains of a small hut which was clearly destroyed by a very large bolt of lightning.  Sifting through the debris, you find an undamaged pendant that seems to tingle in your hand.
106.name: Pendant of Negativity

107.description:
{Pendant of Total Recall}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Forgetfulness spell.
107.event: Alongside the remains of a burnt witch lies a beautiful pendant, intricately designed.  Approaching the corpse with caution, you add the item to your inventory.
107.name: Pendant of Total Recall

108.description:
{Pendant of Courage}

When worn, this item bestows +3 Luck and Morale to your hero's troops.
108.event: Responding to cries for help, you find river Sprites making a sport of dunking an old man.  Feeling vengeful, you rescue the man and drag a Sprite onto dry land for awhile.  The Sprite, uncomfortable in the air, gives you a magic pendant to let him go.
108.name: Pendant of Courage

109.description:
{Everflowing Crystal Cloak}

When worn, this cloak increases your Crystal production by +1 per day.
109.event: Taking shelter from a storm in a small cave,  you notice a small patch of crystal in one corner.  Curious, you discover that the patch is really a cloak, and when you break a piece off it mysteriously grows back.  You decide to take the cloak with you.
109.name: Everflowing Crystal Cloak

11.description:
{Sword of Hellfire}

This right handed weapon increases your Attack skill by +6.
11.event: During a sudden storm, a bolt of lightning strikes a tree, splitting it.  Inside the tree you find a mysterious sword.
11.name: Sword of Hellfire

110.description:
{Ring of Infinite Gems}

When worn, this ring increases your Gem production by +1 per day.
110.event: A cry of pain leads you to a Centaur, caught in a trap.  Upon setting the creature free, he hands you a small pouch.  Emptying the contents, you find a dazzling jeweled ring.
110.name: Ring of Infinite Gems

111.description:
{Everpouring Vial of Mercury}

When equipped, this vial increases your Mercury production by +1 per day.
111.event: A brief stop at a hastily abandoned Wizard's tower turns up a magical vial of mercury that always has a little left on the bottom.  Recognizing a treasure when you see one, you cap it and slip it in your pocket.
111.name: Everpouring Vial of Mercury

112.description:
{Inexhaustible Cart of Ore}

When equipped, this cart provides you with an additional +1 Ore per day.
112.event: You've found a Goblin weapon smithy making weapons for use against humans.  With a tremendous yell you and your army descend upon their camp and drive them away.  A search finds a magic cart that never runs out of ore.
112.name: Inexhaustible Cart of Ore

113.description:
{Eversmoking Ring of Sulfur}

When worn, this ring increases your Sulfur production by +1 per day.
113.event: You visit an alchemist who, upon seeing your army, is swayed by the righteousness of your cause.  The newly loyal subject gives you his eversmoking ring of sulfur to help with the war effort.
113.name: Eversmoking Ring of Sulfur

114.description:
{Inexhaustible Cart of Lumber}

When equipped, this cart provides you with an additional +1 Wood per day.
114.event: Pausing to rest and light a cook fire, you pull wood out of a nearby lumber cart.  As you keep pulling wood from the cart, you notice that its cargo doesn't shrink.  You realize to your delight that the cart is enchanted, so you take it along.
114.name: Inexhaustible Cart of Lumber

115.description:
{Endless Sack of Gold}

When equipped, the Endless Sack of Gold increases your income by 1000 gold per day.
115.event: A little leprechaun dances gleefully around a magic sack.  Seeing you approach, he stops in mid-stride.  The little man screams and stamps his foot ferociously, vanishing into thin air.  Remembering the old leprechaun saying 'Finders Keepers', you grab the sack and leave.
115.name: Endless Sack of Gold

116.description:
{Endless Bag of Gold}

When equipped, the Endless Bag of Gold increases your income by 750 gold per day.
116.event: A noblewoman, separated from her traveling companions, asks for your help.  After escorting her home, she rewards you with a bag filled with gold.
116.name: Endless Bag of Gold

117.description:
{Endless Purse of Gold}

When equipped, the Endless Purse of Gold increases your income by 500 gold per day.
117.event: In your travels, you find a leather purse filled with gold that once belonged to a great warrior king who had the ability to transform any inanimate object into gold.
117.name: Endless Purse of Gold

118.description:
{Legs of Legion}

This item, when equipped by a hero in a town, increases the growth of your 2nd level units (in that town) by 5 per week.
118.event: Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion.  You carefully dust it off before placing it in your pack.
118.name: Legs of Legion

119.description:
{Loins of Legion}

This item, when equipped by a hero in a town, increases the growth of your 3rd level units (in that town) by 4 per week.
119.event: Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion.  You carefully dust it off before placing it in your pack.
119.name: Loins of Legion

12.description:
{Titan's Gladius}

Held with the right hand, this massive relic increases your Attack skill by +12, but reduces your Defense skill by -3.
12.event: A Titan stops you and says, "Pay me 5,000 gold, or I shall slay you where you stand."  You refuse.  The Titan grabs the sword hanging from its belt, but you duck between its legs.  He is so surprised by this maneuver that he trips... falling on his sword and killing himself instantly.
12.name: Titan's Gladius

120.description:
{Torso of Legion}

This item, when equipped by a hero in a town, increases the growth of your 4th level units (in that town) by 3 per week.
120.event: Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion.  You carefully dust it off before placing it in your pack.
120.name: Torso of Legion

121.description:
{Arms of Legion}

This item, when equipped by a hero in a town, increases the growth of your 5th level units (in that town) by 2 per week.
121.event: Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion.  You carefully dust it off before placing it in your pack.
121.name: Arms of Legion

122.description:
{Head of Legion}

This item, when equipped by a hero in a town, increases the growth of your 6th level units (in that town) by 1 per week.
122.event: Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion.  You carefully dust it off before placing it in your pack.
122.name: Head of Legion

123.description:
{Sea Captain's Hat}

When worn, this hat increases your movement at sea, allows you to summon and destroy boats, and protects you from whirlpools.
123.event: An old seaman tells you a tale of an enchanted hat that he used in his youth to rally his crew into fits of efficiency.  He then hands you a faded map that shows where he hid it.  After much exploring, you find it stashed underneath a nearby rock.
123.name: Sea Captain's Hat

124.description:
{Spellbinder's Hat}

When worn, this hat allows you to cast all 5th level spells.
124.event: You see a Wizard fleeing from a Dragon and riding like the wind.  The Wizard opens a portal and rides through, getting his hat knocked off by the edge of the gate.  The Dragon follows, and the gate closes.  You pick the hat up, dust it off, and put it on.
124.name: Spellbinder's Hat

125.description:
{Shackles of War}

When these shackles are wielded in combat, neither you nor your opponent may retreat or surrender.
125.event: Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the elaborately crafted Shackles of War.
125.name: Shackles of War

126.description:
{Orb of Inhibition}

This powerful orb prevents all spell casting in combat.
126.event: You stop to help a Peasant catch a runaway mare.  To show his gratitude, he hands you a tiny sphere.  As soon as you grasp it, you feel the magical energy drain from your limbs...
126.name: Orb of Inhibition

127.description:
{Vial of Dragon Blood}

All dragons under your command receive +5 to their attack and +5 to defense.
127.event: You find a cave guarded by an ancient dragon.  After a fierce battle, you slay him.  Dragon blood supposedly has magical properties, so you carefully gather some in a vial.
127.name: Vial of Dragon Blood

128.description:
{Armageddon's Blade}

+ 3 Attack. + 3 Defense. + 6 Knowledge. + 3 Power. Places Expert Armageddon Spell in your hero's spell book. All allied creatures become immune to Armageddon.
128.event: Deep beneath the earth, you find a vault of the Ancients from before the Silence.  Inside, you find a sealed casket, deeply etched with dire warnings.  Ignoring them, you break the seal.  Inside, you find Armageddon's Blade.
128.name: Armageddon's Blade

129.description:
{Angelic Alliance}

Allows Rampart, Tower, Fortress, Stronghold and Castle creatures to be mixed without a morale penalty, for the player.  Casts Expert Prayer at the start of combat.
129.event: You trip over the Angelic Alliance, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
129.name: Angelic Alliance

13.description:
{Shield of the Dwarven Lords}

This left handed item increases your Defense skill by +2.
13.event: While searching through the rubble of a caved-in mine, you free a group of trapped Dwarves.  Grateful, the leader gives you a finely crafted shield.
13.name: Shield of the Dwarven Lords

130.description:
{Cloak of the Undead King}

30% of battlefield dead are resurrected as Skeletons.  If hero already has the Necromancy skill then the percentages are added to the skill and the level of skill determines what type is resurrected.  Basic: Zombies
Advanced: Wights
Expert:  Liches
130.event: You trip over the Cloak of the Undead King, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
130.name: Cloak of the Undead King

131.description:
{Elixir of Life}

All creatures get a 25% health bonus and gain the regeneration ability.  Does not work on Undead or unliving creatures
131.event: You trip over the Elixir of Life, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
131.name: Elixir of Life

132.description:
{Armor of the Damned}

All opponents have these spells effective on them for fifty turns: Slow, Curse, Weakness, and Misfortune.
132.event: You trip over the Armor of the Damned, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
132.name: Armor of the Damned

133.description:
{Statue of Legion}

All creature production increases by 50%, in all towns based off of the castle creature generation level, does not include flagged structures or other like bonuses.
133.event: You trip over the Statue of Legion, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
133.name: Statue of Legion

134.description:
{Power of the Dragon Father}

+6 to all primary skills, all troops are immune to 1-4th level spells.
134.event: You trip over the Power of the Dragon Father, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
134.name: Power of the Dragon Father

135.description:
{Titan's Thunder}

Hero gains the ability to cast Lightning Bolt for 600 points of damage, does not cost any spell points, adds a spell book into their inventory (permanently).
135.event: You trip over the Titan's Thunder, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
135.name: Titan's Thunder

136.description:
{Admiral's Hat}

No boarding or unboarding ship penalty.  Converts movement points between the Hero's Land and Water movement.
136.event: You trip over the Admiral's Hat, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
136.name: Admiral's Hat

137.description:
{Bow of the Sharpshooter}

Ranged shooters may fire projectiles while adjacent to an enemy creature.  No archery penalty for range or obstacle
137.event: You trip over the Bow of the Sharpshooter, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
137.name: Bow of the Sharpshooter

138.description:
{Wizard's Well}

Regenerates all spell points each day
138.event: You trip over the Wizard's Well, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
138.name: Wizard's Well

139.description:
{Ring of the Magi}

Add 50 rounds to spell duration.
139.event: You trip over the Ring of the Magi, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
139.name: Ring of the Magi

14.description:
{Shield of the Yawning Dead}

This left handed item increases your Defense skill by +3.
14.event: Your troops discover an eerie shrine dedicated to the Undead.  You bless the shrine, causing the stone shield emblem above the altar to crack.  Underneath it is a real shield, which you decide to separate from this unholy place.
14.name: Shield of the Yawning Dead

140.description:
{Cornucopia}

Generates 4 of each precious resource, each day.
140.event: You trip over the Town of Plenty, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
140.name: Cornucopia

141.description:
{Magic Wand}

Transforms equipped artifacts daily.
{Slot1}=Head and Neck
{Slot2}=Right and Left Hand
{Slot3}=Right and Left Ring
{Slot4}=Torso and Feet
{Slot5}=Shoulders and Slot4
141.event: You find the Magic Wand, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
141.name: Magic Wand

142.description:
{Gold Tower Arrow}

Gives power over Arrow Towers. If equipped by attacking hero, towers will not shoot at all. If equipped by defending hero, depends on ballistics skill:
None: Towers shoot twice.
Basic: Towers shoot 3 times.
Advanced: Towers shoot 4 times.
Expert: Towers shoot 5 times.
142.event: You find the Gold Tower Arrow, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
142.name: Gold Tower Arrow

143.description:
{Monster's Power}

Casts Prayer spell on all monsters of one type, randomly chosen from the hero's army at the beginning of each week. Affects all monsters of this type for the week, regardless of owner.
143.event: You find the Monster's Power, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
143.name: Monster's Power

146.description:
{Axe of Smashing}

Gives +5 Attack
plus +1 Attack after 6 victorious battles.

To give this artifact to your Commander, drag it to the Commander icon.
146.event: You pick up the heavy Axe of Smashing. You're sure your Commander would love to smash a few heads with it!
146.name: Axe of Smashing

147.description:
{Mithril Mail}

Gives +12% Health
plus +1% Health after every victorious battle.

To give this artifact to your Commander, drag it to the Commander icon.
147.event: You pick up the gleaming suit of Mithril Mail. This armor will surely extend your Commander's life when worn in battle!
147.name: Mithril Mail

148.description:
{Sword of Sharpness}

Gives +12% Damage
plus +1% Damage after every victorious battle.

To give this artifact to your Commander, drag it to the Commander icon.
148.event: You pick up the glowing Sword of Sharpness. You're sure your Commander will enjoy chopping the enemy to pieces with it!
148.name: Sword of Sharpness

149.description:
{Helm of Immortality}

Revives a slain Commander immediately after battle
(artifact incremental bonuses are not lost).

To give this artifact to your Commander, drag it to the Commander icon.
149.event: You pick up the shining Helm of Immortality. If your Commander wears this, death will never last for long!
149.name: Helm of Immortality

15.description:
{Buckler of the Gnoll King}

This left handed item increases your Defense skill by +4.
15.event: A stone statue of a warrior holds a silver shield.  As you remove the shield, the statue crumbles into dust.
15.name: Buckler of the Gnoll King

150.description:
{Pendant of Sorcery}

Gives +1 Magic Power
plus +1 Magic Power after 10 victorious battles.

To give this artifact to your Commander, drag it to the Commander icon.
150.event: You pick up the ancient Pendant of Sorcery. With this magical pendant, your Commander's Magic Power will grow stronger!
150.name: Pendant of Sorcery

151.description:
{Boots of Haste}

Gives +1 Speed
plus +1 Speed after 10 victorious battles.

To give this artifact to your Commander, drag it to the Commander icon.
151.event: You pick up the well-made Boots of Haste. These boots will surely lend wings to your Commander's feet on the battlefield!
151.name: Boots of Haste

152.description:
{Bow of Seeking}

Gives "No Obstacle Penalty"
plus "No Long-Range Penalty" after 25 victorious battles.

To give this artifact to your Commander, drag it to the Commander icon.
152.event: You pick up the finely-crafted Bow of Seeking. If used by a Commander skilled in archery, long distances and walls will never be a hindrance again!
152.name: Bow of Seeking

153.description:
{Dragon Eye Ring}

Gives Commander Breath Attack (two squares)
and
Dragon nature (gets bonuses as Dragons).

To give this artifact to your Commander, drag it to the Commander icon.
153.event: You pick up the beautiful Dragon Eye Ring. On your Commander's finger, this ring will bestow the power of dragons!
153.name: Dragon Eye Ring

154.description:
{Hardened Shield}

Gives +5 Defense
plus +1 Defense after 6 victorious battles.

To give this artifact to your Commander, drag it to the Commander icon.
154.event: You pick up the Hardened Shield. With this excellent shield, your Commander's defenses will surely improve!
154.name: Hardened Shield

155.event: You pick up Slava's Ring of Power and can feel its strong magic. On your Commander's finger, this ring will bestow great power!
155.name: Slava's Ring of Power

156.event: You pick up the Warlord's Banner. If you give this artifact to your troops, it could lead them to victory!
156.name: Warlord's Banner

157.description:
{Crimson Shield of Retribution}

Held in the left hand, this artifact increases Defense skill by +2 and gives all creatures in a hero's ranks the ability to retaliate against creatures that cannot normally be retaliated against.
157.event: Strapping on the Crimson Shield of Retribution, you notice the look of steely resolve upon the faces of your troops, and now know that they will always be able to answer blood with blood in the heat of battle.
157.name: Crimson Shield of Retribution

158.description:
{Barbarian Lord's Axe of Ferocity}

In addition to the regular bonuses, the Barbarian Lord's Axe of Ferocity gives all non-shooting creatures in a hero's ranks an additional strike with each attack. This extra strike is added to the number of strikes the creature normally makes--if a creature already strikes twice, it will now strike three times. Note: even if making a melee attack, shooting creatures won't receive this bonus.
158.event: You pick up the Barbarian Lord's Axe of Ferocity and it speaks to your mind,"Bring on the enemy and together we shall cut a swath of destruction through their legions!"
158.name: Barbarian Lord's Axe of Ferocity

159.event: You pick up the Dragonheart and feel the powerful drum-beat of ten thousand dragon hearts reverberating through your soul. When you need them, the dragons will come.
159.name: Dragonheart

16.description:
{Targ of the Rampaging Ogre}

This left handed item increases your Defense skill by +5.
16.event: You come upon a bridge spanning a dry gully.  As you begin to cross, a gigantic, maddened Ogre appears from the other side and charges, forcing you to slay it.  You decide to take its shield as a trophy.
16.name: Targ of the Rampaging Ogre

160.event: You pick up the Gate Key. With this incredible relic, you'll be able to enchant your castle gates to keep even your most powerful enemies at bay!
160.name: Gate Key

161.description:
{Helmet}

Worn on the head, this item should increases your Knowledge skill, but it's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
161.event: You pick up the Helmet: Artifact #161. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
161.name: Helmet

162.description:
{Sword}

 Held with the right hand, this sword should increases your Attack skill, but it's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
162.event: You pick up the Sword: Artifact #162. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
162.name: Sword

163.description:
{Shield}

Held with the left hand, this shield should increases your Defense skill, but it's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
163.event: You pick up the Shield: Artifact #163. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
163.name: Shield

164.description:
{Horned Ring}

It's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
164.event: You pick up the Horned Ring: Artifact #164. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
164.name: Horned Ring

165.description:
{3-Gemmed Ring}

It's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
165.event: You pick up the 3-Gemmed Ring: Artifact #165. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
165.name: 3-Gemmed Ring

166.description:
{Neck Broach}

It's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
166.event: You pick up the Neck Broach: Artifact #166. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
166.name: Neck Broach

167.description:
{Armor}

Worn on the torso, this armor should increases your Spell Power skill, but it's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
167.event: You pick up the Armor: Artifact #167. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
167.name: Armor

168.description:
{Surcoat}

It's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
168.event: You pick up the Surcoat: Artifact #168. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
168.name: Surcoat

169.description:
{Boots}

It's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
169.event: You pick up the Boots: Artifact #169. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
169.name: Boots

17.description:
{Shield of the Damned}

This left handed item increases your Defense skill by +6.
17.event: Upon cresting a small hill, you come upon a ridiculous looking sight.  A Sprite is attempting to carry a Shield that is almost as big as it is.  Trying not to laugh, you ask, "Need help?"  The Sprite glares at you and answers, "You think this is funny?  Fine.  You can carry it.  I much prefer flying anyway."
17.name: Shield of the Damned

170.description:
{Horn}

It's useless to use it, probably the power of ERM can make it work.
170.event: You pick up the Horn: Artifact #170. This artifact is {BLANK} and must be programmed by ERM.
170.name: Horn

171.description:
{Hammer of Doom}

When worn, this massive relic increases your Attack skill by +16, but reduces your Defense skill by -6 and Morale -1.
171.event: You find the Hammer of Doom, dust it off, and stick it in your pack."
171.name: Hammer of Doom

172.description:
{Eclipse Shield}

This left handed item increases your Defense skill by +16,  but reduces your Attack skill by -5 and Morale -1.
172.event: You find the Eclipse Shield, dust it off, and stick it in your pack."
172.name: Eclipse Shield

173.description:
{Helmet of Fallen Paladin}

Worn on the head, this item increases your Knowledge skill by +14 but reduces your Spellpower skill by -4 and Morale -1.
173.event: You find the Helmet of Fallen Paladin, dust it off, and stick it in your pack."
173.name: Helmet of Fallen Paladin

174.description:
{Dragonrider's Armor}

Worn on the torso, this item increases your Spellpower skill by +14 but reduces your Knowledge skill by -4 and Morale -1.
174.event: You find the Dragonrider's Armor, dust it off, and stick it in your pack."
174.name: Dragonrider's Armor

175.description:
{Trident of Dominion}

This right-handed weapon increases your Attack skill by +7.
175.event: You finally found a well after a long search. Your soldiers could not get the bucket of water out, however. Something was preventing it from coming out. Your banner carrier had to descend in the well himself. It appeared that a trident was blocking the way.
175.name: Trident of Dominion

176.description:
{Shield of Naval Glory}

This left-handed shield increases your Defense skill by +7.
176.event: You meet an old admiral at the tavern. After a couple of hours full of tales about glorious battles and days long passed he gifts you his parade shield.
176.name: Shield of Naval Glory

177.description:
{Crown of the Five Seas}

Worn on the head, this item increases your Knowledge skill by +6.
177.event: You see a fight on a hill nearby. As you get closer, you see two nix. One is winning, and as he is about to land a finishing blow, you intervene. The defeated nix thanks you for your help, and gifts you with his armor. He believes you deserve it more than he does.
177.name: Crown of the Five Seas

178.description:
{Royal Armor of Nix}

Worn on the torso, this item increases your Power skill by +6.
178.event: You hardly set a camp, leaving the saddle for the first time for the day, as some critter sneaked up on you and pulled one of your boots in his hole. Swearing silently, you search the hole with your hand. Instead of a boot, you touch something sharp. Amazed, you pull out a crown."
178.name: Royal Armor of Nix

179.description:
{Golden Goose}

In addition to component effect when equipped, the Golden Goose increases your income by 4750 gold per day.
179.event: You wander on an abandoned house of a collector in search for a camp place. Most of the goods were long stolen by the marauders, but you were able to find a couple of dusty pet statues. You vaguely recognize one of them. You rub the dust off one of them, and discover a golden goose.
179.name: Golden Goose

18.description:
{Sentinel's Shield}

Held with the left hand, this relic increases your Defense skill by +12, but reduces your Attack skill by -3.
18.event: You find a large box that seems to be made from some unknown metal.  When you touch it, the box opens with a loud hiss, revealing a gleaming shield within.
18.name: Sentinel's Shield

180.description:
{Diplomat's Cloak}

In addition to component effect the Diplomat's Cloak multiplies your hero army strength by 3 (for neutral armies and Thieves guild).
180.event: You met an unusual scarecrow today. Instead of scaring the, well, crows, it was intelligently persuading them to leave the field. You agreed to help the scarecrow to find the closest seer in exchange for the secret. The scarecrow gives you its cloak.
180.name: Diplomat's Cloak

181.description:
{Pendant of Reflection}

In addition to component effect this item increases your chance to resist a hostile spell by 20%.
181.event: Soldiers approach you with talks about a miracle. You are intrigued and follow them. You see a strange sight indeed; a wanderer sitting on top of the fire trap, without any harm. You offer him money in exchange for the secret, but he laughs and vanishes in the air. You see a strange pendant left in the middle of the trap."
181.name: Pendant of Reflection

182.description:
{Ironfist of the Dark Paladin}

In addition to components effects, at the beginning of combat the Fist will cast Haste, Bloodlust, Fire Shield and Counterstrike (all Expert) lasting for 50 turns on all allied troops.
182.event: On passing by a small cave you hear deep thumping. You enter the cave and see a juvenile Cyclops cracking nuts with an enormous hammer. Every strike ends in shells and nut pieces being scattered all over the cave. You teach the Cyclops to crack nuts more sparingly by crushing them against each other. Overjoyed with this discovery, the youth gifts you the hammer.
182.name: Ironfist of the Dark Paladin

183.description:
{Pendant of Downfall}

Worn about the neck,this item decreases enemy's Morale by 2.
183.event: You visit the jeweler's shop. You land your eyes on a bracelet, but the shopkeeper immediately warns you that it is cursed. You fear no curses, and put the bracelet on immediately. The bracelet vanishes in a flash. Enraged, you are about to kill the shopkeeper, but he offers you Pendant of Downfall in return. You agree."
183.name: Pendant of Downfall

184.event: The day looked not so great from the beginning. You walked under the ladder, met a woman with an empty bucket and stepped on a black cat. Apparently, it is not your misfortune, but the guy in rugs who has been following you. You order to seize the loser, but he runs away. As he vanishes, you notice a strange doll that he dropped.
184.name: Shaman's Puppet

185.event: During your overnight stay you hear hooves clatter nearby. You look around in darkness and notice a demon's figure, ready to stab you with its horns. You barely survive the attack and keep his horseshoe as a trophy.
185.name: Demon's Horseshoe

186.event: You meet a traveling circus on your way. One of the artists had such a deft disguise that you have drawn a sword, ready to defend yourself. It appeared that a pretty actress was hiding behind the mask. Laughing, she gifts you the mask.
186.name: Hideous Mask

187.description:
{Runes of Imminency}

Decreases enemy's Luck by 1.
187.event: Close by, on a mountain edge you see a mage trying to cast a spell. Fiery symbols are already flashing in the sky, when he, while blinded by the light, trips and falls down. The mage perishes, and you gather the chain of mysterious stones in your backpack.
187.name: Runes of Imminency

188.description:
{Ring of Suppression}

Worn on the finger, this ring decreases enemy's Morale by 1.
188.event: You ordered fried eggs for breakfast. The cook managed to find the eggs for you. He also found a ring in the bird's nest that he passed to you.
188.name: Ring of Suppression

189.description:
{Mana Crystal}

Increase number of spells of your creatures by 1 at the beginning of each combat.
189.name: Mana Crystal

19.description:
{Helm of the Alabaster Unicorn}

Worn on the head, this item increases your Knowledge skill by +1.
19.event: A traveling tinker in need of supplies offers you a helm with a unicorn's horn on its top in exchange for food and water.  Curious, you accept, and later find out that the helm is magical.
19.name: Helm of the Alabaster Unicorn

190.description:
{Flask of Mana}

Increase number of spells of your creatures by 2 at the beginning of each combat.
190.name: Flask of Mana

191.description:
{Vial of Mana}

Increase number of spells of your creatures by 3 at the beginning of each combat.
191.name: Vial of Mana

192.description:
{Soothsayer's Boots}

When worn, this item allows you to cast all 1st level spells.
192.name: Soothsayer's Boots

193.description:
{Wizard's Ring}

When worn, the ring allows you to cast all 2nd level spells.
193.name: Wizard's Ring

194.description:
{Robe of the Magi}

The Robe of Magi allows you to cast all 3rd level spells.
194.name: Robe of the Magi

195.description:
{Magus Staff}

The Magus Staff allows you to cast all 4th level spells.
195.name: Magus Staff

196.description:
{Fencer's Fist Shield}

This shield increases your Defense skill by 3 and the health of all your units by 1.
196.name: Fencer's Fist Shield

197.description:
{Ring of Elements}

When equipped, the Ring of Elements allows you to summon Elementals of all types. It also allows you to summon Elementals of different types during combat.
197.name: Ring of Elements

198.description:
{Observer's Eye}

When equipped, this item allows to cast the View Earth, View Air, and Visions spells.
198.name: Observer's Eye

199.description:
{Astral Shield}

When equipped, this shield increases your Defense skill by 3 and casts Forgetfulness on enemy shooters.
199.name: Astral Shield

2.description:
{The Grail}

Carry the Grail to the city of your choice and the populace there will build a fantastic structure which will provide a tremendous advantage to the city's owner.
2.event: You trip over the Grail, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
2.name: The Grail

20.description:
{Skull Helmet}

Worn on the head, this item increases your Knowledge skill by +2.
20.event: A brief stop at an improbable rural inn yields an exchange of money, tales, and accidentally, luggage.  You find a magical helm in your new backpack.
20.name: Skull Helmet

200.description:
{Ice Shield}

When equipped, the Ice Shield increases your Defense skill by 3 and makes your units immune to Cold spells.
200.name: Ice Shield

201.description:
{Ring of Negativity}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Lightning Bolt spell.
201.name: Ring of Negativity

202.description:
{Crossbow}

When equipped, the Crossbow upgrades your Archers, Marksmen to Crossbowmen and Cavaliers to Arche Rider, and provides you with 10 additional shots.
202.name: Crossbow

203.description:
{Strong Armor}

When equipped, the Strong Armor increases your Power skill by 4 and makes your units immune to the Explosion and Disruption Ray spells.
203.name: Strong Armor

204.description:
{Ionized Armor}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to all offensive Air spells.
204.name: Ionized Armor

205.description:
{Green Armor}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to all offensive Earth spells.
205.name: Green Armor

206.description:
{Chilled Armor}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to all offensive Fire spells.
206.name: Chilled Armor

207.description:
{Streamline Armor}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to all offensive Water spells.
207.name: Streamline Armor

208.description:
{Ring of Precision}

When equipped, this ring casts Precision on all friendly shooters at the beginning of each combat.
208.name: Ring of Precision

209.description:
{Ring} {of} {the} {Thousand} {Storms}

When equipped, this item casts Haste at the beginning of combat on all your units.
209.name: Ring of the Thousand Storms

21.description:
{Helm of Chaos}

Worn on the head, this item increases your Knowledge skill by +3.
21.event: Your army is ambushed by a small tribe of wild (and none too bright) Orcs.  You fend them off easily and the survivors flee in all directions.  One of the Orcs was wearing a polished horned helm.  Figuring it will make a good souvenir, you take it.
21.name: Helm of Chaos

210.description:
{Shield} {of} {the} {Dark} {Paladin}

Increases your Defense skill by +6 and casts Death Ripple at the beginning of combat.
210.name: Shield of the Dark Paladin

211.description:
{Arrow} {Quiver}

Grants a 20 additional shots to all your shooters at the beginning of combat.
211.name: Arrow Quiver

212.description:
{Pendant} {of} {Hastiness}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Slow spell.
212.name: Pendant of Hastiness

213.description:
{Foggy} {Shield}

Increases your Defense skill by 2 and casts Air Shield at the beginning of combat on all your units.
213.name: Foggy Shield

214.description:
{Enchanted} {Gloves}

Casts Shield at the beginning of combat on all your units.
214.name: Enchanted Gloves

215.description:
{Gloves} {of} {Arcane} {Fire}

Casts Fire Shield at the beginning of combat on all your units.
215.name: Gloves of Arcane Fire

216.description:
{Stone} {Shield}

Increases your Defense skill by 3 and casts Stone Skin at the beginning of combat on all your units.
216.name: Stone Shield

217.description:
{Sacrificial} {Dagger}

This left handed item increases your Attack skill by +2 and casts Bloodlust at the beginning of combat on all your units.
217.name: Sacrificial Dagger

218.description:
{Gelu's Bow}

When equipped, Gelu's Bow upgrades your Wood Elves and Grand Elves to Sharpshooter Elves, and provides you with 10 additional shots.
218.name: Gelu's Bow

219.description:
{Compendium of Magic}

In addition to component effect, at the begining of each battle the Compendium of Magic summon all four third upgrades elementals.
219.name: Compendium of Magic

22.description:
{Crown of the Supreme Magi}

Worn on the head, this item increases your Knowledge skill by +4.
22.event: A mad wizard who has been terrorizing the region has foolishly chosen you as his target today.  Realizing that his power comes from his crown, you take aim with your bow, knocking the crown from his head and releasing him from his crazed madness.  Grateful to be free, he lets you keep the crown.
22.name: Crown of the Supreme Magi

220.description:
{Lightning Rod}

This rod increases your Attack, Defense, Knowledge skills by 3 and your Power skill by 6. It gives the hero Lightning Bolt and Chain Lighnigs spells and makes all units vulnerable to these spells (only artifact immunity works). Chain lighting can be cast on all enemy units without damaging ally creatures. Each stack hit by the Chain Lightning spell gets an additional hit by Lightning Bolt.
220.name: Lightning Rod

221.description:
{Dwarven Helmet}

Increases hero defense skill by 3 and renders units immune to defence-reducing spells.
221.name: Dwarven Helmet

222.description:
{Dwarven Mine}

At the beginning of battle casts expert Landmine.
222.name: Dwarven Mine

223.description:
{Ritual dagger}

Allows to upgrade all Mages, Archmages, Monks and Zealots in your army to Liches.
223.name: Ritual dagger

224.description:
{Sacred War Hammer}

Held with the right hand, Sacred War Hammer casts expert Bless at the beginning of battle.
224.name: Sacred War Hammer

225.description:
{Tiara of Knowledge}

Increases your knowledge skill by 5 and renders units immune to Hypnotize and Forgetfulness.
225.name: Tiara of Knowledge

226.description:
{Shield of the Ancients}

Increases hero's spellpower skill by +12.
226.name: Shield of the Ancients

227.description:
{Minor Phylactery}

Summons scary Demiliches to help you in the battlefield.
227.name: Minor Phylactery

228.description:
{Major Phylactery}

Summons scary Demiliches to help you in the battlefield.
228.name: Major Phylactery

229.description:
{Supreme Phylactery}

Summons scary Demiliches to help you in the battlefield.
229.name: Supreme Phylactery

23.description:
{Hellstorm Helmet}

Worn on the head, this item increases your Knowledge skill by +5.
23.event: Your army is ambushed by a small tribe of wild (and none too bright) Orcs.  You fend them off easily and the survivors flee in all directions.  One of the Orcs was wearing a polished horned helm.  Figuring it will make a good souvenir, you take it.
23.name: Hellstorm Helmet

230.description:
{Relic Phylactery}

Summons scary Demiliches to help you in the battlefield.
230.name: Relic Phylactery

231.description:
{Black Luster Sword}

Held with the right hand, the Black Luster Sword increases all four primary skills by +5. Summon Archangels on the battlefield. Cast Mirth on your units
231.name: Black Luster Sword

232.description:
{Apocalypse's Blade}

In addition to components effects, at the beginning of combat Apocalypse's Blade cast Bloodlust, Protection from Fire, Fire Shield, Frenzy and Slayer to the allies. (This does not prevent you from being immune to the enemy's Fire Shield.)
232.name: Apocalypse's Blade

233.description:
{Scepter of Magic}

Held with the right hand, Scepter of Magic increase your Power and Knowledge by +10.
233.name: Scepter of Magic

234.description:
{Axe of Might}

Held with the right hand, Axe of Might increase your Attack and Defense by +10.
234.name: Axe of Might

235.description:
{Sun Emperor Plate Armor}

Increases all four primary skills by +5. Renders your units immune to all damage fire spells.
235.name: Sun Emperor Chainmail

236.description:
{Shield of the Vermillion Bird}

Increase your Attack, Defense and Power skill by +7 and Knowledge by +4. Summon Vermilion Birds on the battlefield.
236.name: Shield of the Vermillion Bird

237.description:
{Crown of the Fire King}

Increases all four primary skills by +3. Renders your units immune to debuff fire spells.
237.name: Crown of the Fire King

238.description:
{Orb of Chaos}

This orb doubles damage done by combat spells and casts all four magic protection spells on your units.
238.name: Orb of Chaos

239.description:
{Pendant of Magic}

Wearing this item renders your units immune to the Magic Arrow spell.
239.name: Pendant of Magic

24.description:
{Thunder Helmet}

When worn, this relic increases your Knowledge skill by +10, but reduces your Power skill by -2.
24.event: A glint of golden light catches your eye.  Upon further investigation, you find a golden helm hidden under a bush.
24.name: Thunder Helmet

240.description:
{Regenerative Necklace of Mana}

This necklace helps you recover 5 extra spell point per day.
240.name: Regenerative Necklace of Mana

241.description:
{Bucket Helmet}

This weird helmet reduces your Defense skill by 2 making your units immune to all Mind Spells."
241.name: Bucket Helmet

242.description:
{Field Martial's Ring}

When worn, the Field Martial's Ring increases your Morale by 3.
242.name: Field Martial's Ring

243.description:
{Horseshoe}

When equipped, the Horseshoe increases your Luck by 2.
243.name: Horseshoe

244.description:
{Crystal Glyph}

When equipped, this item casts Magic Mirror at the beginning of combat on all your units.
244.name: Crystal Glyph

245.description:
{General's Order}

When worn, the General's Order increases your Morale by 2.
245.name: General's Order

246.description:
{Ring of Fortune}

When worn, the Ring of Fortune increases your Luck by 3.
246.name: Ring of Fortune

247.description:
{Mithril Cuirass}

When worn, this armor increases your Power and Defense skill by 6.
247.name: Mithril Cuirass

248.description:
{Mithril Helmet}

When worn, this helmet increases your Knowledge and Defense skill by 6.
248.name: Mithril Helmet

249.description:
{Misfortune Ring}

Worn on the finger, the Misfortune Ring reduces enemy's Luck by 3.
249.name: Misfortune Ring

25.description:
{Breastplate of Petrified Wood}

Worn on the torso, this item increases your Power skill by +1.
25.event: A gang of Rogues is sifting through the possessions of dead warriors.  Scaring off the scavengers, you note the Rogues had overlooked a strange breastplate.
25.name: Breastplate of Petrified Wood

250.description:
{Dragon's Head}

When equipped, this item reduces enemy's Morale by 2.
250.name: Dragon's Head

251.description:
{Panic Ring}

Worn on the finger, the Panic Ring cast Sorrow in all enemies.
251.name: Panic Ring

252.description:
{Pendant of Despair}

Worn about the neck, the Pendant of Despair reduces enemy's Morale and Luck by 3.
252.name: Pendant of Despair

253.description:
{Ring of the Snake Eyesight}

Puts a most susceptible enemy stacks under your control at the beginning of the battle.
253.name: Ring of the Snake Eyesight

254.description:
{Shield of the Light Paladin}

Increases your Defense skill by +6 and casts Exorcism at the beginning of combat on all enemy undead.
254.name: Shield of the Light Paladin

255.description:
{Axe of the Piedmont King}

Increases your Attack skill by 5 and casts Counterstrike at the beginning of combat on all your units.
255.name: Axe of the Piedmont King

256.description:
{Ring of Anti-magic}

When equipped, this item casts Anti-magic at the beginning of combat on all your units.
256.name: Ring of Anti-magic

257.description:
{Earrings of Just Man}

When equipped, this item casts Bless at the beginning of combat on all your units.
257.name: Earrings of Just Man

258.name: Hell Baron's Gloves

259.description:
{Helm of the Hydra Queen}

All creatures in the hero's army, excluding the attackers on 2 cells, are endowed with the hydra skill.
259.name: Helm of the Hydra Queen

26.description:
{Rib Cage}

Worn on the torso, this item increases your Power skill by +2.
26.event: You trip over what was the rib cage of a large creature.  Upon further examination, you discover the rib cage to be a piece of armor.
26.name: Rib Cage

260.description:
{Wayfarer's Boots}

Worn on the feet, allows your hero to move over rough terrain without penalty.
260.name: Wayfarer's Boots

261.description:
{Exchange Cloak}

When worn, the Attack and Defense of the allied hero and enemy hero are reversed.
261.name: Exchange Cloak

262.description:
{Amulet of the return of Samsara}

When casting Resurrection and Animate Undaed, the spells will also be cast on all the ally creatures with 30% of the hero's power. Transform different skeletons into their living forms.
262.name: Amulet of the return of Samsara

263.description:
{Implosion Amplifying Bracelet}

When casting implosion, the spell will also be cast on all the other enemy creatures with 30% of the hero's power.
263.name: Implosion Amplifying Bracelet

264.description:
{Atma Sword}

When worn, this mysterious sword sets the lowest value of Attack and Defense to the highest value.
264.name: Atma Sword

265.description:
{Atma Robe}

When worn, this mysterious robe sets the lowest value of Power and Knowledge to the highest value.
265.name: Atma Robe

266.description:
{Horn of the Abyss}

After a stack of living creatures is slain, a stack of Fangarms will rise in their stead and will stay loyal to the hero after the battle concluides. Total Hit Points of this stack will be equal to half of the slain stack's total Hit Points, but quantity of the Fangarms summoned thus should not exceed half of quantity of creatures in the slain stack. Slaying Fangarms will not trigger the Horn effect.
266.name: Horn of the Abyss

267.description:
{Cape of Silence}

While wearing this cape, neither you nor your opponent will be able to cast level 1-2 spells during combat.
267.name: Cape of Silence

268.description:
{Ring of Oblivion}

When worn, makes all losses in the battle irrevocable (except with drain life).
268.name: Ring of Oblivion

269.description:
{Charm of Eclipse}

This artifact reduces the Power skill of enemy hero by 10% during combat.
269.name: Charm of Eclipse

27.description:
{Scales of the Greater Basilisk}

Worn on the torso, this item increases your Power skill by +3.
27.event: You meet an old Armorer who claims he owes you a favor.  Taking him up on it, he pieces together some Basilisk scales, forming a well-fashioned breastplate.
27.name: Scales of the Greater Basilisk

270.description:
{Seal of Sunset}

This artifact reduces the Power skill of enemy hero by 10% during combat.
270.name: Seal of Sunset

271.description:
{Plate of Dying Light}

Worn on a torso, this item reduces the Power skill of enemy hero by 25% during combat.
271.name: Plate of Dying Light

272.description:
{Endless mug of happiness beer}

This artifact casts Mirth to the expert level at the beginning of battle.
272.name: Endless mug of happiness beer

273.description:
{Eye of the Green Dragon}

This powerful dragon eye increases the minimum damage by +1 and allows Green Dragonling to be upgraded to Green Dragon and become Bone Dragon and Ghost Dragon into Green Dragon the next day.
273.name: Eye of the Green Dragon

274.description:
{Eye of the Red Dragon}

This powerful dragon eye increases the maximum damage by +1 and allows Red Dragonling to be upgraded to Red Dragon and become Bone Dragon and Ghost Dragon into Red Dragon the next day.
274.name: Eye of the Red Dragon

275.description:
{Eye of the Faerie Dragon}

This powerful dragon eye increases the minimum damage by +2 and allows Faerie Dragonling to be upgraded to Faerie Dragon and become Dracolich into Faerie Dragon the next day.
275.name: Eye of the Faerie Dragon

276.description:
{Eye of the Rust Dragon}

This powerful dragon eye increases the maximum damage by +2 and allows Rust Dragonling to be upgraded to Rust Dragon and become Dracolich into Rust Dragon the next day.
276.name: Eye of the Rust Dragon

277.description:
{Eye of the Azure Dragon}

This powerful dragon eye increases the minimum and maximum damage by +2 and allows Azure Dragonling to be upgraded to Azure Dragon and become Dracolich into Azure Dragon the next day.
277.name: Eye of the Azure Dragon

278.description:
{Prismatic Eye of the God Dragon}

This omnipotent artifact increases the minimum and maximum damage by +5 and allows Red and Green Dragonlings to be upgraded to Fire Dragon, Azure Dragonling to Ice Dragon, Faerie Dragonling and Rust Dragonling in their third upgrade form the next day.
278.name: Prismatic Eye of the God Dragon

28.description:
{Tunic of the Cyclops King}

Worn on the torso, this item increases your Power skill by +4.
28.event: You catch a Cyclops skinny dipping, and as a prank you make off with his clothes.  Later, you realize the tunic is magical.
28.name: Tunic of the Cyclops King

29.description:
{Breastplate of Brimstone}

Worn on the torso, this item increases your Power skill by +5.
29.event: You meet a blacksmith who is in the process of melting down old pieces of armor and weapons to reclaim the metal.  When he learns of your quest, he gives you a breastplate that he claims refused to melt, and is therefore of no value to him.
29.name: Breastplate of Brimstone

3.description:
{Catapult}

Use this war machine to target your enemy's fortifications in combat.
3.event: You trip over the Catapult, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
3.name: Catapult

30.description:
{Titan's Cuirass}

When worn, this massive relic increases your Power skill by +10, but reduces your Knowledge skill by -2.
30.event: A Titan stops you and says, "Pay me 5,000 gold, or I shall slay you where you stand."  You refuse.  The Titan grabs the sword hanging from its belt, but you duck between its legs.  He is so surprised by this maneuver that he trips... falling on his sword and killing himself instantly.  You relieve him of his belongings.
30.name: Titan's Cuirass

31.description:
{Armor of Wonder}

Worn on the torso, the Armor of Wonder increases all four primary skills by +1.
31.event: A gang of Rogues is sifting through the possessions of dead warriors.  Scaring off the scavengers, you note the Rogues had overlooked a dirty, but serviceable, breastplate.
31.name: Armor of Wonder

32.description:
{Sandals of the Saint}

Worn on the feet, the Sandals of the Saint increase all four primary skills by +2.
32.event: A Nomad trader seeks protection from a tribe of Goblins.  For your assistance, he gives you a finely crafted pair of sandals made from the softest leather.  Looking closely, you see fascinating ancient carvings engraved on the leather.
32.name: Sandals of the Saint

33.description:
{Celestial Necklace of Bliss}

Worn about the neck, the Celestial Necklace of Bliss increases all four primary skills by +3.
33.event: After rescuing a Sorceress from a cursed tomb, she rewards your heroism with an exquisite jeweled necklace.
33.name: Celestial Necklace of Bliss

34.description:
{Lion's Shield of Courage}

Held with the left hand, the Lion's Shield of Courage increases all four primary skills by +4.
34.event: You've come upon a fight between a Necromancer and a Paladin.  The Necromancer blasts the Paladin with a fire bolt, bringing him to his knees.  Acting quickly, you slay the evil one before the final blow.  The grateful Paladin gives you the shield that saved him.
34.name: Lion's Shield of Courage

35.description:
{Sword of Judgement}

Held with the right hand, the Sword of Judgement increases all four primary skills by +5.
35.event: You come upon a battle where a Paladin has been mortally wounded by a group of Zombies.  He asks you to take his sword and finish what he started.  As you pick it up, it begins to hum, and then everything becomes a blur.  The Zombies lie dead, the sword dripping with blood.  You strap it to your belt.
35.name: Sword of Judgement

36.description:
{Helm of Heavenly Enlightenment}

Worn on the head, the Helm of Heavenly Enlightenment increases all four primary skills by +6.
36.event: You spy a gleaming object poking up out of the ground.   You send a member of your party over to investigate.  He comes back with a golden helmet in his hands.  You realize that it must be the Helm of Heavenly Enlightenment, the only helm ever rumored to be made from solid gold.
36.name: Helm of Heavenly Enlightenment

37.description:
{Quiet Eye of the Dragon}

Worn on a finger, this item increases your Attack and Defense skills by +1.
37.event: While venturing into a decrepit hut you find the skeleton of a long dead witch.  Investigation of the remains reveals a ring with a Dragon's eye set into it.
37.name: Quiet Eye of the Dragon

38.description:
{Red Dragon Flame Tongue}

Held with the right hand, this item increases your Attack and Defense skills by +2.
38.event: As you are walking along a narrow path, a nearby bush suddenly bursts into flames.  Before your eyes the flames become the image of a beautiful woman.  She holds out a magnificent sword to you.
38.name: Red Dragon Flame Tongue

39.description:
{Dragon Scale Shield}

Held with the left hand, this item increases your Attack and Defense skills by +3.
39.event: You meet an old Armorer who claims he owes you a favor.  Taking him up on it, he pieces together some Dragon scales, forming a well-fashioned shield.
39.name: Dragon Scale Shield

4.description:
{Ballista}

Use this war machine to target your enemy's troops in combat.
4.event: You trip over the Ballista, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
4.name: Ballista

40.description:
{Dragon Scale Armor}

Worn on a torso, this item increases your Attack and Defense skills by +4.
40.event: You meet an old Armorer who claims he owes you a favor.  Taking him up on it, he pieces together some Dragon scales, forming a well-fashioned breastplate.
40.name: Dragon Scale Armor

41.description:
{Dragonbone Greaves}

Worn on the feet, this item increases your Knowledge and Power skills by +1.
41.event: You trip over what seem to be the bones of a large Dragon.  Upon further examination, you discover the bones to be a pair of greaves.
41.name: Dragonbone Greaves

42.description:
{Dragon Wing Tabard}

Worn on the shoulders, this item increases your Knowledge and Power skills by +2.
42.event: Ridding the countryside of the hideous Dragon who made a sport of eating noblemen's Knights, you are honored with a Dragon Wing Tabard.
42.name: Dragon Wing Tabard

43.description:
{Necklace of Dragonteeth}

Worn about the neck, this item increases your Knowledge and Power skills by +3.
43.event: An old shaman stands in the road before you, screaming something in a language you can't understand.  He suddenly vanishes in a cloud of smoke.  When the smoke clears, there is a long string of Dragon teeth in the spot where he was standing.
43.name: Necklace of Dragonteeth

44.description:
{Crown of Dragontooth}

Worn on the head, this item increases your Knowledge and Power skills by +4.
44.event: While out scaring up game, your troops find a mysterious crown levitating about three feet off of the ground.  They hand it to you, and you notice an inscription.  It reads: "Brains best brawn and magic beats might.  Heed my words, and you'll win every fight."
44.name: Crown of Dragontooth

45.description:
{Still Eye of the Dragon}

Worn on the finger, this item increases your Luck and Morale by +1.
45.event: While venturing into a decrepit hut you find the skeleton of a long dead witch.  Investigation of the remains reveals a ring with a Dragon's eye set into it.
45.name: Still Eye of the Dragon

46.description:
{Clover of Fortune}

The Clover of Fortune increases your Luck by +1.
46.event: While walking across a patch of dried vegetation, you are surprised to find a healthy, green four-leaf clover.
46.name: Clover of Fortune

47.description:
{Cards of Prophecy}

The Cards of Prophecy increase your Luck by +1.
47.event: You meet a traveler who offers to let you draw a card from the strange deck that he carries.  When you refuse, he draws one himself.  He has a momentary look of surprise on his face, then vanishes with a pop, dropping the cards to the floor.  You gather them, and leave.
47.name: Cards of Prophecy

48.description:
{Ladybird of Luck}

The Ladybird of Luck increases your Luck by +1.
48.event: An old witch who seems to have been expecting you, hands you a small statue and departs, never having said a word.
48.name: Ladybird of Luck

49.description:
{Badge of Courage}

The Badge of Courage increases your Morale by +1 and grants immunity to all hostile mind spells.
49.event: After saving a young boy from a vicious pack of Wolves, you return him to his father's manor.  The grateful nobleman awards you with a Badge of Courage.
49.name: Badge of Courage

5.description:
{Ammo Cart}

The Ammo Cart ensures that your missile troops will never run out of ammunition in combat.
5.event: You trip over the Ammo Cart, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
5.name: Ammo Cart

50.description:
{Crest of Valor}

The Crest of Valor increases your Morale by +1.
50.event: After freeing a princess of a neighboring kingdom from the evil clutches of despicable slavers, she awards you with a Crest of Valor.
50.name: Crest of Valor

51.description:
{Glyph of Gallantry}

The Glyph of Gallantry increases your Morale by +1.
51.event: Ridding the countryside of the hideous Minotaur who made a sport of eating noblemen's Knights, you are honored with the Glyph of Gallantry.
51.name: Glyph of Gallantry

52.description:
{Speculum}

The Speculum increases your Scouting radius by +1.
52.event: A merchant from far away lands trades you a new invention of his people for traveling supplies.  It makes distant objects appear closer, and he calls it... a Speculum.
52.name: Speculum

53.description:
{Spyglass}

The Spyglass increases your Scouting radius by +1.
53.event: An old man claiming to be an inventor asks you to try his latest invention.  He calls it... a Spyglass.
53.name: Spyglass

54.description:
{Amulet of the Undertaker}

Worn about the neck, this amulet increases your Necromancy skill by 5%.
54.event: A dirty amulet lies next to a freshly dug grave. Upon investigation, you discover it to be the enchanted Amulet of the Undertaker, long thought lost by mortals.
54.name: Amulet of the Undertaker

55.description:
{Vampire's Cowl}

Worn about the shoulders, this cowl increases your Necromancy skill by 10%.
55.event: You manage to find a Vampire's resting place during the day, and are able to slay him easily.  Just for good measure, you take his cowl.
55.name: Vampire's Cowl

56.description:
{Dead Man's Boots}

Worn on the feet, these boots increase your Necromancy skill by 15%.
56.event: Discovering a pair of beautifully beaded boots made from the finest and softest leather, you thank the anonymous donor and add the boots to your inventory.
56.name: Dead Man's Boots

57.description:
{Garniture of Interference}

Worn about the neck, this item increases your Magic Resistance by 5%.
57.event: You've come upon a fight between a Necromancer and a Paladin.  The Necromancer blasts the Paladin with a fire bolt, bringing him to his knees.  Acting quickly, you slay the evil one before the final blow.  The grateful Paladin gives you the armor that saved him.
57.name: Garniture of Interference

58.description:
{Surcoat of Counterpoise}

Worn about the shoulders, this item increases your Magic Resistance by 10%.
58.event: You've come upon a fight between a Necromancer and a Paladin.  The Necromancer blasts the Paladin with a fire bolt, bringing him to his knees.  Acting quickly, you slay the evil one before the final blow.  The grateful Paladin gives you the cloak that saved him.
58.name: Surcoat of Counterpoise

59.description:
{Boots of Polarity}

Worn on the feet, these boots increase your Magic Resistance by 15%.
59.event: A Nomad trader seeks protection from a tribe of Goblins.  For your assistance, he gives you a finely crafted pair of boots made from the softest leather.  Looking closely, you see fascinating ancient carvings engraved on the leather.
59.name: Boots of Polarity

6.description:
{First Aid Tent}

The First Aid Tent provides healing to your troops during each round of combat.
6.event: You trip over the First Aid Tent, dust it off, and stick it in your pack.
6.name: First Aid Tent

60.description:
{Bow of Elven Cherrywood}

This bow increases your Archery skill by 5%.
60.event: A chance meeting with a famous Archer finds you in a game of knucklebones pitting his bow against your horse.  You win.
60.name: Bow of Elven Cherrywood

61.description:
{Bowstring of the Unicorn's Mane}

This bowstring increases your Archery skill by 10%.
61.event: An ensnared Unicorn whinnies in fright.  Murmuring soothing words, you set her free.  Snorting and stamping her front hoof once, she gallops off.  Looking down you see that she dropped what appears to be a finely crafted bowstring.
61.name: Bowstring of the Unicorn's Mane

62.description:
{Angel Feather Arrows}

These arrows increase your Archery skill by 15%.
62.event: Not really wanting to know where the Angel is whose feathers were used for these arrows, you take them and quickly depart.
62.name: Angel Feather Arrows

63.description:
{Bird of Perception}

This figurine increases your Eagle Eye skill by 5%.
63.event: An old witch who seems to have been expecting you, hands you a small statue and departs, never having said a word.
63.name: Bird of Perception

64.description:
{Stoic Watchman}

This figurine increases your Eagle Eye skill by 10%.
64.event: An old witch who seems to have been expecting you, hands you a small statue and departs, never having said a word.
64.name: Stoic Watchman

65.description:
{Emblem of Cognizance}

This item increases your Eagle Eye skill by 15%.
65.event: An old witch who seems to have been expecting you, hands you a small talisman and departs, never having said a word.
65.name: Emblem of Cognizance

66.description:
{Statesman's Medal}

Worn about the neck, the Statesman's Medal reduces the cost of surrendering.
66.event: You pause to help a diplomat with a broken axle fix his problem.  In gratitude, he gives you a medal with magical properties which he says will, "help people see things your way."
66.name: Statesman's Medal

67.description:
{Diplomat's Ring}

Worn on the finger, the Diplomat's Ring reduces the cost of surrendering.
67.event: You pause to help a diplomat with a broken axle fix his problem.  In gratitude, he gives you a ring with magical properties which he says will, "help people see things your way."
67.name: Diplomat's Ring

68.description:
{Ambassador's Sash}

Worn about the shoulders, the Ambassador's Sash reduces the cost of surrendering.
68.event: You pause to help a diplomat with a broken axle fix his problem.  In gratitude, he gives you a sash with magical properties which he says will, "help people see things your way."
68.name: Ambassador's Sash

69.description:
{Ring of the Wayfarer}

When placed on the finger, this ring increases the combat speed of all your units by +1.
69.event: Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey.  He reaches into a sack and withdraws a strange ring which he hands to you.
69.name: Ring of the Wayfarer

7.description:
{Centaur's Axe}

This right handed weapon increases your Attack skill by +2.
7.event: You see a heavy axe embedded deeply in the ground.  After several unsuccessful attempts by your army to remove it, you tightly grip the handle of the axe and effortlessly pull it free.
7.name: Centaurs Axe

70.description:
{Equestrian's Gloves}

Worn on the hands, these gloves increase your hero's movement rate over land.
70.event: A brief stop at an improbable rural inn yields an exchange of money, tales, and accidentally, luggage.  You find a magical pair of gloves in your new backpack.
70.name: Equestrian's Gloves

71.description:
{Necklace of Ocean Guidance}

Worn about the neck, this necklace increases your hero's movement rate at sea.
71.event: An old sea captain is being tortured by Ogres.  You save him, and in return he rewards you with a wondrous necklace that will guide you at sea.
71.name: Necklace of Ocean Guidance

72.description:
{Angel Wings}

Worn about the shoulders, these wings allow you to fly.
72.event: Not really wanting to know where the Angel is who belongs to these wings, you take them and quickly depart.
72.name: Angel Wings

73.description:
{Charm of Mana}

This charm helps you recover 1 extra spell point per day.
73.event: You come upon a caravan of gypsies who are feasting and fortifying their bodies with mead.  They call you forward and say, "If you prove that you can dance the Rama-Buta, we will reward you."  You don't know it, but try anyway.  They laugh hysterically, but admire your bravery, giving you a strange charm.
73.name: Charm of Mana

74.description:
{Talisman of Mana}

This talisman helps you recover 2 extra spell points per day.
74.event: You come upon a caravan of gypsies who are feasting and fortifying their bodies with mead.  They call you forward and say, "If you prove that you can dance the Rama-Buta, we will reward you."  You don't know it, but try anyway.  They laugh hysterically, but admire your bravery, giving you a strange talisman.
74.name: Talisman of Mana

75.description:
{Mystic Orb of Mana}

This orb helps you recover 3 extra spell points per day.
75.event: You come upon a caravan of gypsies who are feasting and fortifying their bodies with mead.  They call you forward and say, "If you prove that you can dance the Rama-Buta, we will reward you."  You don't know it, but try anyway.  They laugh hysterically, but admire your bravery, giving you a strange orb.
75.name: Mystic Orb of Mana

76.description:
{Collar of Conjuring}

Worn about the neck, this item increases the duration of all your spells by 1.
76.event: Before you appears a levitating glass case with a golden choker perched upon a bed of crimson velvet.  At your touch, the lid opens and the choker floats into your awaiting hands.
76.name: Collar of Conjuring

77.description:
{Ring of Conjuring}

Worn on a finger, this item increases the duration of all your spells by 2.
77.event: You find a small tree that closely resembles the great Warlock, Brimstone, with a ring around one of its twigs.  Scraps of clothing and rotting leather lead you to suspect that it IS Brimstone, transformed.  Since you can't help him, you take the magic ring.
77.name: Ring of Conjuring

78.description:
{Cape of Conjuring}

Worn about the shoulders, this item increases the duration of all your spells by 3.
78.event: Before you appears a levitating glass case with a folded cloak perched upon a bed of crimson velvet.  At your touch, the lid opens and the cloak floats into your awaiting hands.
78.name: Cape of Conjuring

79.description:
{Orb of the Firmament}

This powerful orb causes your Air spells to inflict an additional 50% damage.
79.event: You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety.  You agree, and he offers as payment a strange orb of the elements.
79.name: Orb of the Firmament

8.description:
{Blackshard of the Dead Knight}

This right handed weapon increases your Attack skill by +3.
8.event: The widow of a former Captain of the Guard admires your quest and gives you the enchanted Sword that her husband relied on during his tour of duty.
8.name: Blackshard of the Dead Knight

80.description:
{Orb of Silt}

This powerful orb causes your Earth spells to inflict an additional 50% damage.
80.event: You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety.  You agree, and he offers as payment a strange orb of the elements.
80.name: Orb of Silt

81.description:
{Orb of Tempestuous Fire}

This powerful orb causes your Fire spells to inflict an additional 50% damage.
81.event: You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety.  You agree, and he offers as payment a strange orb of the elements.
81.name: Orb of Tempestuous Fire

82.description:
{Orb of Driving Rain}

This powerful orb causes your Water spells to inflict an additional 50% damage.
82.event: You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety.  You agree, and he offers as payment a strange orb of the elements.
82.name: Orb of Driving Rain

83.description:
{Recanter's Cloak}

While wearing this cloak, neither you nor your opponent will be able to cast level 3 or higher spells during combat.
83.event: Responding to the panicked cries of a damsel in distress, you discover a young woman fleeing from a hungry bear.  You slay the beast in the nick of time, and the grateful Sorceress weaves a magic cloak from the bear's hide.
83.name: Recanter's Cloak

84.description:
{Spirit of Oppression}

This item negates all Morale bonuses during combat for both you and your opponent.
84.event: Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the Spirit of Oppression.
84.name: Spirit of Oppression

85.description:
{Hourglass of the Evil Hour}

This item negates all Luck bonuses during combat for both you and your opponent.
85.event: A surprise turn in the landscape finds you in the midst of a grisly scene - vultures picking at the aftermath of a terrible battle.  Your cursory search of the remains turns up an enchanted hourglass.
85.name: Hourglass of the Evil Hour

86.description:
{Tome of Fire Magic}

This heavy book contains all spells in the school of Fire Magic.  It must be equipped for the spells to be available.
86.event: You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety.  You agree, and he offers as payment a copy of a book of the elements.
86.name: Tome of Fire Magic

87.description:
{Tome of Air Magic}

This heavy book contains all spells in the school of Air Magic.  It must be equipped for the spells to be available.
87.event: You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety.  You agree, and he offers as payment a copy of a book of the elements.
87.name: Tome of Air Magic

88.description:
{Tome of Water Magic}

This heavy book contains all spells in the school of Water Magic.  It must be equipped for the spells to be available.
88.event: You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety.  You agree, and he offers as payment a copy of a book of the elements.
88.name: Tome of Water Magic

89.description:
{Tome of Earth Magic}

This heavy book contains all spells in the school of Earth Magic.  It must be equipped for the spells to be available.
89.event: You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety.  You agree, and he offers as payment a copy of a book of the elements.
89.name: Tome of Earth Magic

9.description:
{Greater Gnoll's Flail}

This right handed weapon increases your Attack skill by +4.
9.event: A clumsy Gnoll has killed himself with his own flail.  Knowing your superior skill with this weapon, you confidently remove the spectacular flail from the fallen creature.
9.name: Greater Gnoll's Flail

90.description:
{Boots of Levitation}

When worn, these boots allow you to walk across water.
90.event: Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey.  He reaches into a chest and withdraws a strange pair of boots which he hands to you.
90.name: Boots of Levitation

91.description:
{Golden Bow}

When wielded, the Golden Bow allows your troops to shoot through any obstacle or at any range without penalty.
91.event: A chance meeting with a famous Archer finds you in a game of knucklebones pitting his bow against your horse.  You win.
91.name: Golden Bow

92.description:
{Sphere of Permanence}

Wielding this sphere renders your units immune to the Dispel Magic spell.
92.event: You meet an old Wizard friend of yours traveling in the opposite direction.  He presents  you with a gift:  An orb that prevents the use of the dispel magic spell on your allies.
92.name: Sphere of Permanence

93.description:
{Orb of Vulnerability}

During combat, this orb negates the natural magic resistance of all creatures on the battlefield.
93.event: You meet an old Wizard friend of yours traveling in the opposite direction.  He presents  you with a gift:  An orb that allows nearby magic resistant creatures to be harmed by magic.
93.name: Orb of Vulnerability

94.description:
{Ring of Vitality}

This item increases the health of all your units by +1.
94.event: While pausing to rest, you notice a bobcat climbing a short tree to get at a crow's nest.  On impulse, you climb the tree yourself and scare off the cat.  When you look in the nest, you find a collection of shiny stones and a ring.
94.name: Ring of Vitality

95.description:
{Ring of Life}

This item increases the health of all your units by +1.
95.event: While pausing to rest, you notice a bobcat climbing a short tree to get at a crow's nest.  On impulse, you climb the tree yourself and scare off the cat.  When you look in the nest, you find a collection of shiny stones and a ring.
95.name: Ring of Life

96.description:
{Vial of Lifeblood}

This item increases the health of all your units by +2.
96.event: You find a mystical shrine hidden among the trees.  Floating above the altar is a Vial said to contain the blood of life.  You very carefully remove it, taking care not to disturb anything else.
96.name: Vial of Lifeblood

97.description:
{Necklace of Swiftness}

Worn about the neck, this necklace increases the combat speed of all your units by +1.
97.event: Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey.  He reaches into a sack and withdraws a strange necklace which he hands to you.
97.name: Necklace of Swiftness

98.description:
{Boots of Speed}

Worn on the feet, these boots increase your hero's movement rate over land.
98.event: Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey.  He reaches into a chest and withdraws a strange pair of boots which he hands to you.
98.name: Boots of Speed

99.description:
{Cape of Velocity}

Worn about the shoulders, this cape increases the combat speed of all your units by +2.
99.event: A brief stop at an improbable rural inn yields an exchange of money, tales, and accidentally, luggage.  You find a magical cloak in your new backpack.
99.name: Cape of Velocity
